meanings.definition: To spend time in a lazy or relaxed manner.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he loafed on the couch all day.
meanings.sent2: She often loafed in the park, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent3: The cat loafed lazily in the sunbeam, purring contentedly.
meanings.sent4: Time loafed by as they relaxed by the riverside.
meanings.sent5: The old man loafed on the porch, watching the world go by.

meanings.sent1: During the weekend, they loafed around the house with no plans.
meanings.sent2: The students loafed in the cafeteria during their break.
meanings.sent3: The dog loafed near the fireplace, seeking warmth on a cold day.
meanings.sent4: The clouds loafed in the sky, moving slowly with the breeze.
meanings.sent5: She loafed by the window, daydreaming about her next adventure.

meanings.sent1: After work, he loafed on the sofa, watching TV.
meanings.sent2: They loafed about in the backyard, enjoying the fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The cat loafed around the house, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: The river loafed through the valley, meandering peacefully.
meanings.sent5: She loafed on the hammock, swaying gently in the breeze.
